para.text: Each package holds a number of Smalltalk scripts that are run at judicious moments during the loading/unloading process. The scripts available are as follows:

li.text: Pre-install -- evaluated before package loading commences. This may be useful in order to set up some prerequisite conditions for the package loaded to be successful. Alternatively, you may wish to check that the
is in a suitable state to accept the new package.

Post-install -- evaluated immediately after a package has been installed. This is often used to perform initialization of the package as a whole that could not be performed during the individual class initializations that take place during the load.
Pre-uninstall -- evaluated immediately before a package is uninstalled. This will normally be used when it is necessary to undo any actions that were set up in the Post-install script.
Post-uninstall -- evaluated once the package uninstall is complete.
